parts.text: {"word":"boatmanship","priority":"★★☆","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"noun","definition":"操船術、ボートの操縦技術","english_definition":"The skill of handling a boat effectively and safely.","examples":[{"sentence":"Good boatmanship is essential for navigating safely in rough seas.","translation":"荒れた海を安全に航行するためには、優れた操船術が不可欠です。"},{"sentence":"He demonstrated excellent boatmanship during the regatta.","translation":"彼はレガッタで卓越した操船技術を披露しました。"},{"sentence":"The course teaches basic boatmanship skills, including navigation and maintenance.","translation":"そのコースでは、航行やメンテナンスを含む基本的な操船技術を教えます。"}],"collocations":["good boatmanship (優れた操船術)","poor boatmanship (未熟な操船術)","demonstrate boatmanship (操船術を披露する)","learn boatmanship (操船術を学ぶ)","basic boatmanship (基本的な操船術)","seamanship (航海術、船乗りとしての技能 - boatmanshipを含むより広い概念)"],"synonyms":["seamanship","navigation skills","sailing skills","handling a boat","boat handling"],"antonyms":["poor handling","lack of skill"],"related_words":["boat (ボート)","seaman (船員)","seafaring (航海)","navigation (航海)","pilotage (水先案内)","sailing (セーリング)","yachting (ヨット)","watercraft (水上艇)"],"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"B2-C1 (専門的な語彙)","frequency_google_ngram":"比較的低頻度 (Relatively low frequency)","priority":"★☆☆"},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"\"**Boatmanship**\" refers specifically to the skill and knowledge required to operate a boat effectively and safely. It encompasses a range of abilities, including navigation, boat handling, maintenance, and understanding of weather conditions. While often used interchangeably with \"seamanship,\" the latter is a broader term that includes all aspects of working on a ship or boat, including cargo handling, ropework, and other maritime skills. Boatmanship is particularly relevant to smaller vessels and recreational boating.","priority":"★★☆"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"✗ He showed a great boatmanship by crashing into the dock.","correct":"✓ He showed poor boatmanship by crashing into the dock.","note":"\"Boatmanship\" implies skill and competence. Crashing into the dock indicates a lack of skill, so \"poor boatmanship\" is more appropriate."},{"incorrect":"✗ Boatmanship is only important for sailors.","correct":"✓ Boatmanship is important for anyone operating a boat.","note":"Boatmanship is essential for anyone who operates a boat, regardless of whether they are a sailor or not."}],"priority":"★★☆"},"etymology":{"value":"Combination of \"boat\" and \"-manship\". \"Boat\" is from Old English \"bāt\". \"-manship\" is a suffix denoting skill or art.","priority":"★☆☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/ˈboʊtsmənʃɪp/","syllables":"boat-sman-ship"},"inflection":{"notes":"Uncountable noun (通常、複数形はありません)"},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"Learning proper **boatmanship** is crucial for safety on the water.","translation":"適切な操船術を学ぶことは、水上での安全にとって非常に重要です。","type":"general","meaning_category":"操船術の重要性"},{"sentence":"His **boatmanship** was tested during the sudden squall.","translation":"彼の操船術は突然のスコールで試された。","type":"skill assessment","meaning_category":"操船術の評価"},{"sentence":"The instructor emphasized the importance of **boatmanship** in adverse conditions.","translation":"インストラクターは悪条件下での操船術の重要性を強調した。","type":"instruction","meaning_category":"操船術の指導"}]}
